guide.title: Step-by-Step Guide
guide.intro: Welcome to OmniNote! This guide will walk you through all the important features to get the most out of your intelligent note-taking app.

create.title: Create a New Note
create.description: Click the "New Note" button in the left sidebar. You can create a blank note or choose a template from the dropdown menu.

edit.title: Edit Notes
edit.description: Select a note from the list to open it in the editor. The title and content are saved automatically as you type.

pin.title: Pin Notes
pin.description: Hover over a note in the list and click the icon to keep it at the top of your list.

personalize.title: Personalize Notes
personalize.description: In the editor, click the icon to the left of the title to assign a fitting icon to your note.

linking.title: Connecting Your Ideas: Wiki-Links
linking.description1: Create direct links between your notes by typing the title of another note inside double square brackets. The title must match exactly (it is case-insensitive).
linking.description2: These links become clickable in the preview mode and create explicit connections in the Knowledge Graph, helping you build a true web of knowledge.

tasks.title: Task Management
tasks.intro: Capture tasks directly in your notes using Markdown syntax:

dueDate.title: Add Due Dates
dueDate.description: Add a due date by appending `@{YYYY-MM-DD}` to the end of the task. Example: `- [ ] Prepare important presentation @{2024-12-24}`.

view.title: Tasks View
view.description: Switch to the "Tasks" view in the left sidebar to see all your tasks, intelligently grouped by due date.

use.title: Use Templates
use.description: Start a new note faster by choosing a template from the "New Note" dropdown.

save.title: Save Your Own Templates
save.description: If you have a note structure you want to reuse, open the note in the editor and click

manage.title: Manage Templates
manage.description: In the "Templates" view, you can use or delete your saved templates.

ai.title: The AI Agent Swarm
ai.intro: Open the right sidebar to access the AI agents. They help you enhance your notes.

recipes.title: AI Recipes
recipes.description: Pre-built workflows for complex tasks like creating a blog post

ai.analysis: Generates a summary and suggests relevant tags for your note.
ai.creative: Brainstorms new ideas based on your note's content.
ai.image: Creates an image based on the title and content of your note. Choose different styles for creative results.
ai.plan: Creates an actionable plan or checklist from your ideas.
ai.more: ... and more agents for research, translation, and formatting!

graph.title: Visualizing Knowledge
graph.description1: The Knowledge Graph in the right sidebar visualizes the connections between your notes. Notes are linked by common tags (solid lines) or by direct [[Wiki-Links]] (dashed lines).
graph.description2: Click on a node in the graph to jump directly to the corresponding note.

history.title: Version History
history.description: Accidentally deleted something? No problem. The History view in the right sidebar saves previous versions of your notes. You can restore an older version with a single click on "Restore".

q1.question: What is Markdown?
q1.answer: Markdown is a simple markup language for formatting text. It allows you to create headings, lists, bold text, and more without taking your hands off the keyboard. For example: `# Heading` or `**bold**`.

q2.question: How does the AI work? Is my data secure?
q2.answer: OmniNote uses the Google Gemini API to provide its AI features. Your notes are sent to the API for processing. We store your data securely in your browser (localStorage) and only send it to the API when you actively run an AI agent. Your data is not used for model training.

q3.question: Can I export my data?
q3.answer: Yes! Go to Settings > Data Management. There, you can export all your notes and settings as a JSON file. This is a great way to create backups.

q4.question: Does the app work offline?
q4.answer: Yes, OmniNote is designed to work offline. All your notes are stored locally in your browser. You can create, edit, and view notes without an internet connection. However, the AI features require an active internet connection.

term1.definition: A specialized AI tool that performs a specific task, such as creating a summary, brainstorming ideas, or providing a translation.

term2.definition: The collection of all available AI agents that work together to analyze and improve your notes.

term3.definition: A predefined, multi-step AI workflow that performs complex tasks with a single click, such as generating a full blog post from bullet points.

term4.definition: A visual representation of your notes as a network graph. Notes are nodes, and common tags create connections (edges) between them.

term5.definition: A lightweight markup language for formatting text using simple syntax. Fully supported in the OmniNote editor.

whatsNew.title: Latest Updates
whatsNew.intro: Here's a look at the exciting new features we've recently added to OmniNote!

feature1.title: New AI Recipe: Social Media Post
feature1.description1: Instantly transform your notes into engaging social media content! The new Social Post recipe in the AI sidebar drafts a concise post, adds relevant hashtags, and even suggests new tags for your note.
feature1.description2: Perfect for sharing your ideas on platforms like X, LinkedIn, or Mastodon.

feature2.title: Collapsible Completed Tasks
feature2.description1: Your Tasks view just got cleaner. Completed tasks are now neatly tucked away in a collapsible "Completed" section at the bottom.
feature2.description2: This helps you focus on what's next, while still giving you easy access to your accomplishments.

feature3.title: Enhanced Help Center
feature3.description: You're looking at it! We've revamped the Help Center with a new "What's New" tab and improved styling to make finding information easier and more pleasant.
